description.narrative: The objectives of the Public Sector Modernization Project for Kosovo are: a) to strengthen the performance of key budget organizations in budget formulation, budget execution, and public procurement; (b) to establish the foundations for fiscally sustainable payroll management and effective human resource management in the core civil service; and (c) to create conditions for further automation of government work processes and for development of e-government applications. Extension of the project closing date is from December 31, 2014 till June 30, 2016. The restructuring does not entail revisions to the Project Development Objective (PDO), monitoring indicators or total project costs. There is no change to the current safeguards category: OP 4.01 is still not triggered. Extension of the project closing date will allow for a higher probability of achieving the project’s development objectives.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Ref. PAD III.F. | Description :Covenants applicable to project implementation:Other conditions in LegalAgreements and Financial Covenants: The Project Coordinator w i l lsubmit Annual Work Plans approved by the Inter-Govern |Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Improved quality of budget formulation and execution in the budget organizations that would participate in the proposed project

baseline.value: PEFA assessment 2009 indicators: # PI-1: score: C (actual expenditure deviated from budget by more than 15% in one of the lastthree years);# PI-12 (iii, iv): Multi-year perspective in fiscal planning, expenditure policy & budgeting # score: C PI-12 (iii)score: C; PI-12 (iv) score: D;# Only 3/7 quality indicators of budget submissions met by all 5 beneficiary BOs; no BO meets 3quality indicators for budget execution

target.value: PEFA PI-1 score B; PEFA PI-12 (iii), (iv) score B;At least 4/5 beneficiary organizations meet at least 5/7 intermediate outcomeindicators

actual.value: PEFA 2013PI-01 = BPI-12 = C+PI-12(iii) = CPI-12 (iv) = DDisaggregated data available separatelyQuality indicators onlypartially met

title.narrative: Improved budget execution rates by beneficiary budget organizations (BOs)

baseline.value: (a) Deviation from original approved budget expenditure by beneficiary BOs does not exceed 10 percent (in aggregate and by BO) forthe year. (3/5=NO)(b) Variance in expenditure composition exceeds overall deviation in primary expenditure by no more than 5percentage points for the year. (5=NO)(c) Targets (expenditure and milestones) for at least 70 percent of projects in approvedbudgets are achieved. (5= NO)

target.value: All beneficiary BOs meet the interim outcome indicators for budget execution

actual.value: a. Partially met. Health met, Education and Agriculture did not.b. Partially met. Agriculture and Health met. Education didnot.c. Partially met. Education met, others did not.

title.narrative: Increased bidder participation in public procurement tenders and cost savings achieved through Quick Gains actions and e-procurement modules

baseline.value: 8,270 bidders participated in procurement tenders in 2008 (1.7 bidders per contract);No electronic procurement transactions;QGstudy reports significant price disparities within procurement categories in the same year (2008):# Civil works/ roads: up to 90%;# Maintenance: 39%# Security: 41%; # Buildings rental 64%; # Food 95%; # Medicines 17-70%; # Office supplies 26%; # Fuel9.3% in a year/ up to 31% in a monthNo electronic procurement transactions QG study reports significant price disparitieswithin procurement categories in the same year (2008):# Civil works/ roads: up to 90%; # Maintenance: 39%# Security: 41%;# Buildings rental 64%; # Food 95%; # Medicines 17-70%; # Office supplies 26%; # Fuel 9.3% in a year/ up to 31% in a month

target.value: Bidder participation increases by 15%.Price disparities in QG procurement categories do not exceed 10% in the same year.Costsavings of at least 5% for each category achieved.

actual.value: Partially met due to delays with completion of the e-procurement contract.To-date the number of CAs registered into system is 65from the total of 75 CAs at central level (or about 85%). The , number of Economic operators registered into system is 1100 orabout13% from 8500 businesses that are considered as potential bidders.About 180 procurements are conducted through e-procurementsystem. About 40 procurements completed through e-procurement system, i.e. contract award notices have been published. Based onthe completed 40+ procurements for which contracts have been awarded, bidders participation was at 4.3 bidders per contract, i.e.significantly higher than expected 15% increase. The Central Procurement Agency (CPA) signed contracts and start implementationof centralized procurement for 11 categories contracted through centralized procurements in 2015/2016. Total value of all signedcontracts is about EUR 45million and all contracts are signed as framework contracts with

title.narrative: Centralized data management and systems maintenance leads to efficiency gains

baseline.value: Approx. EUR 0.15 million annual spending on duplicated maintenance, plus some EUR 0.4 million in duplicated equipment anddevelopment of stand-alone systems

target.value: Cost savings from ICT systems maintenance of 30% (compared to stand-alone systems)

actual.value: Fully met. Utilization of Data center resources in terms of physical space and equipment capacities continuously increases due todemand from all government institutions. To date about 70% of physical space of Data center is utilized and 100% of storagecapacities provided through the initial Data Center contract (in 2014).Project savings provided significant additional investmentin the DC storage capacity. Currently utilization of storage capacities supplied through PSMP savings is at 50%. Main governmentinstitutions that are using physical space of DC besides MPA are: Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Health, Public ProcurementRegulatory Commission, Ministry of Interior, Ministry of Education, Science and Technology, Kosovo Business Registration Agency,Ministry of Culture, Youth and Sport, Ministry of Local Government, Kosovo Customs and Ministry of Justice. About 30 othergovernment institutions use the MPA DC for sharing dedicated hardware equipment for their IT syst

title.narrative: Improved quality of budget and MTEF submissions of beneficiary budget organizations

baseline.value: Beneficiary BOs comply with 3 out 7 budget submission quality criteria (see comment for explanation)

target.value: All 5 beneficiary BOs meet the 7 quality criteria

actual.value: Partially met- performance differs across beneficiaries.

title.narrative: HRMIS functions as a civil service registry and online data links between HRMIS-payroll-Treasury systems enable effective fiscal and management controls in payroll administration

baseline.value: HRMIS does not include grade or salary step data; includes only personnel data for 3 civil service organizations

target.value: HRMIS rolled out in all civil service organizations

actual.value: Partially met.Preparation of job positions, sending requests for approval of job positions, salary coefficient, request forstarting of recruitment processes, and similar activities are done only through the HRMIS. Requests and any other communicationbetween personnel offices and DCSA/MPA also being done only electronically through HRMIS. So far about 950 recruitments areinitiated through HRMIS, which means that about 4000 transactions are done between DCSA/MPA and personnel offices across governmentinstitutions. HRMIS continues to be used by all personnel offices of government institutions at central and local levels for theirdaily works and business processes related to the MPA or Departments Civil Service Administration (DCSA), but still the use of theHRMIS is in limited in terms of modules and functionalities. Although MPA has started entering data for each institution, theHRMIS still does not include job title, grade or salary step for all civil servants. So far only

title.narrative: Ministry responsible for public administration has necessary capacity to exercise key human resource management functions for the core civil service

baseline.value: MPA Department of Civil Service Administration has 25 staff (14 in payroll unit)

target.value: Department responsible for civil service management has staff trained in all core HR functions

actual.value: Full met. Note: By beginning of the year 2015 payroll unit with all its staff is transferred to MoF.The Department for CivilService Administration (DCSA) within MPA increased its capacities through trainings. DCSA personnel is trained jointly with HRmanagers in suing the HRMIS modules and HRM functions ( usage of the new methodology for job classification, performance appraisalsystem, HR planning, etc.) and have become trainer for HRMIS and HR functions. The DCSA through their trainers regularly trainsand provides support for personnel officers from all government institutions in the HRMIS and HR functions. Separate trainingsessions were conducted for about 200 HR managers and HR officers in: HRMIS, Job Catalogue and Performance Appraisal Systems.DCSAhas increased own capacity through trainings and most of own trained staff (10 people) became trainers for all core HR functions.MPA/DCSA uses its own trainers continuously conducts trainings for different levels of c

title.narrative: Enhanced security and interoperability of government information systems (through centralized data storage and systems maintenance,and interoperability framework)

baseline.value: No adequate, secure data storage and backup facility for major ICT systems;No interoperability between major ICT systems

target.value: Data center is operational;Reduced risk of data loss;Improved access to data control and physical security;New systems developedaccording to the interoperability framework.

actual.value: Fully met. The National Data Center was inaugurated in February 2014 and is fully operational.In addition, the ICT SecurityManagement Framework for Kosovo Government ICT Systems is developed and adopted by the MPA.Data Center is fully operational andutilization of Data Center resources from all government institutions is increased in continuity. Since Data Center becameoperational no data loss, cyber attacks, or threats have occurred. This is due to physical security of DC and implementation ofsecurity management framework recommendations. For almost three years only a 1.00h downtime occurred

title.narrative: Status of public procurement activities is regularly monitored through contract management information system

baseline.value: No central capacity exists to monitor procurement cycle

target.value: PPA and PPRC use electronic system to regularly monitor public procurement activities by all contracting authorities in Kosovo

actual.value: Fully met for Centralized procurements. Will be met for the rest of CAs after January 1, 2017.With introduction ofe-procurement system PPRC, CPA, PRB and all interested bodies are able to monitor procurement cycles through functionalities in themonitoring module and contract management module. Starting from September 1st, 2016 PPRC started to monitor procurements (forthose are conducted through e-procurement system) and easily able to have (automatically generated) statistical reports onprocurement types, procurement no, bidder participation, contract value, awarded bidders, start/closing date, etc. Contractmanagement module has not started to be used because no contract yet is included in this module.Starting September 1, 2016, CAsand government institution have started to use the e-procurement system to monitor and track procurement cycle for procurementsconducted through the e-procurement system.

title.narrative: Transparent and coherent pay and grading structure introduced in the core civil service supported by improved ICT systems that enable effective fiscal and management controls in payroll administration

baseline.value: No grading system in the civil service; Wide pay variations among civil service bodies;PEFA indicator PI-18 (effectiveness ofpayroll controls) score: D+;No link between HRMIS, payroll, and Treasury

target.value: 100% of permanent civil servants graded; Equal bases pay for posts of equal grade and salary step across civil servicebodies;Improved PEFA PI-18 score (C+ or above)

actual.value: Partially met. Job title and grading are set for about 95% of permanent civil servants, but since new grading salary structurerelated to job classification is not implemented yet there is no equal salary for same job title/position. Wide pay variationsamong civil service bodies still continue.Implementation of the new salary structure has not started as per government decisionor on September 1st, 2016 because there was no decision on the value of the coefficient that will be used for the new jobclassification in new grading salary structure. Government joint commission MPA/MoF has continued completion of Job Classificationfor all civil servants (15500). 1700 job titles for civil service are standardized based on job classification methodology and forabout 300 job titles (which cover about 60% of total number of Civil Servants) are prepared job descriptions. Job description forremaining 1400-1500 job titles remains to be prepared by MPA.By the end of 2016 the government h

title.narrative: Performance appraisal system is introduced and used as a basis for progression along salary steps

baseline.value: No regular performance appraisal system or mechanism for salary progression

target.value: Managers trained (no.); Performance appraisal launched in pilot organizations

actual.value: Partially met.The new guideline for implementation of the new performance appraisal system is developed and adopted by theMinister of MPA. Although all HR managers are trained to use the new performance appraisal system, HR managers still are notusing this system as mechanism for promotion and salary management. Managers from all government institutions (200) are trainedto use performance appraisal system
